name: Mesmerizing Gaze
summary: When you meet someone's gaze, they are unable to look away.
description:
When you meet someone's gaze, they are unable to look away. Choose one target creature. That creature must succeed at a Will save or be fascinated until the end of your next turn; the DC for this save is equal to your class DC or spell DC, whichever is higher. If the creature succeeds at its save or its fascination ends due to a hostile action, it becomes temporarily immune to your Mesmerizing Gaze for 1 day.

When you select this feat, it gains either the arcane or occult trait; once you make this choice, you can't change it.Traits

Archetype: This feat belongs to an archetype.

Emotion: This effect alters a creature's emotions. Effects with this trait always have the mental trait as well. Creatures with special training or that have mechanical or artificial intelligence are immune to emotion effects.Enchantment: Effects and magic items with this trait are associated with the enchantment school of magic, typically involving mind control, emotion alteration, and other mental effects.Mental: A mental effect can alter the target's mind. It has no effect on an object or a mindless creature.Visual: A visual effect can affect only creatures that can see it. This applies only to visible parts of the effect, as determined by the GM.
